intro: Eriocaulon heterochiton, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments in the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense spike of small, three-ranked flowers, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Eriocaulon heterochiton plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
